Bradley, Todd wrote:
>  > > I don't understand why /any/ project would
>  > > ask non-coders (or people who can code, but are not allowed
>  > to code on
>  > > the project, like testers) to test any code with JUnit.
> 
> Perhaps they are using JUnit as a test driver for
> "automated external (QA-style) tests" that just
> happen to use Java as their scripting language.
> That's what we do, and it's working pretty well,
> thank you.

Yes, I suppose that's one condition under which it would work: if Java 
is used as a scripting language to test the application from the 
outside. Where I have seen it fail miserably and repeatedly is when 
"external" testers (converted programmers) try to write object-level 
tests for code they're not permitted to or don't know how to change.

You're the first person to tell me they had this working, so I'd never 
thought it possible before. I'm glad to hear it's working for you, and 
I'll keep it in mind the next time this discussion rolls around.

Take care.
--
